repeatedPassword.description:
just in case of some issues with frontend,
we won't save garbage to the database

409.description: Appears when user with such email already exists

type.description: link to the docs with more details about the error

title.description: title of the error, short description

status.description: http status code of the error, e.g. 404

detail.description: detail of the error, comprehensive message for the end user (e.g. 'customer with id 12344321 not found')

data.description: additional data that can be used by the client to handle the error

instance.description: error instance, unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem

409.description: Appears when user with such email already exists

type.description: link to the docs with more details about the error

title.description: title of the error, short description

status.description: http status code of the error, e.g. 404

detail.description: detail of the error, comprehensive message for the end user (e.g. 'customer with id 12344321 not found')

data.description: additional data that can be used by the client to handle the error

post.description:
or you can respond with some message and let user to login
    default behavior is to force user to login and make sure his password is correct

parameters.name: page
parameters.description:
Page number to retrieve.If you provide invalid value the default page number will applied

Example: 1

Default Value: 1

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Number of records per page.

Example: 20

Default Value: 50

Max Value: 100

If provided value is greater than max value, max value will be applied.

parameters.name: filter.id
parameters.description:
Filter by id query param.

Format: filter.id={$not}:OPERATION:VALUE

Example: filter.id=$not:$like:John Doe&filter.id=like:John

Available Operations

  • $eq
  • $in

parameters.name: filter.name
parameters.description:
Filter by name query param.

Format: filter.name={$not}:OPERATION:VALUE

Example: filter.name=$not:$like:John Doe&filter.name=like:John

Available Operations

  • $contains

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Parameter to sort by.

To sort by multiple fields, just provide query param multiple types. The order in url defines an order of sorting

Format: fieldName:DIRECTION

Example: sortBy=id:DESC&sortBy=createdAt:ASC

Default Value: createdAt:DESC,id:DESC

Available Fields

  • id
  • name
  • createdAt
  • updatedAt

parameters.name: search
parameters.description:
Search term to filter result values

Example: John

Default Value: No default value

parameters.name: searchBy
parameters.description:
List of fields to search by term to filter result values

Example: name,roleType

Default Value: By default all fields mentioned below will be used to search by term

Available Fields

  • name
  • roleType

503.description: The Health Check is not successful

info.title: Platform Application is responsible for the common things, like user, tenants, auth, management.
info.description: It has a common api for tenants and auth. By default designed as a multi-tenant, but you can have only one tenant and manage it like this, in case if in future you would like to expand.

action is the identifier of the permission
usually it is the name of the permission in lowercase
e.g. ADMIN.USER.CREATE, ADMIN.USER.READ, ADMIN.USER.UPDATE, ADMIN.USER.DELETE, ADMIN.USER.BULK_UPLOAD
